text:
I really love going there, everytime I am amazed by the view.
You should definitely check it out at the sunset (or sunset if you are brave enough).
It is a bit too crowded in my opinion but the landscapes are awesome!

One of the best hiking experiences I've ever had. The scenery was like out of a story book. Pretty colours and the weather was perfect (winter time in December). The place was safe and you can take your time along the paths. The accommodation was also great, cosy and food was good enough. The peak was also pretty fun. Just make sure you travel light but with proper clothing. And I mean proper winter hiking clothing. No snow but temperatures can be really low depending on the weather. Overall this was one of my best hiking trips.
This hike was too hard for me... I gave up...
It is very beautiful however it is too crowded...But I would recommend you to go for a hike around, you will be in immersion in the tropical jungle!

I love going there ! It is definitely my favorite place in LuoDong for a quick bite.
Don't go there if you are on a diet... you won't be able to contain yourself
It is beautiful but way too touristy
It is beautiful but way too touristy
My favorite dumplings spot in town!
My favorite dumplings spot in town!

When I lived in LuoDong, this place was 3 minutes walking from my school so I was going there 4 times a week.
Very good food, cheap and I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes, that is quite impressive.
As a sunset lover, this is my favorite place to watch it in Taipei. When I go there, I usually bring some food and drinks and with my friends.
A temple hidden in the moutains... It is one of my favorite Taoist temple in Taiwan, not touristy at all. You should check it out!
This scenery is really impressive... It feels like a dream spot, with all the lanterns and typical shops. Try to avoid going there on weekends because it usually gets extremely busy.
Good food but I definitely prefer Taipei's night markets (Rahoe Nigh market for example).
I love it! This is my favorite spot of Taipei!
One of my favorite movie Silence (directed by Martin Scorsese) was shot around this spot, it is highly impressive !
In my opinion this place is overrated, it is too crowded!
It was a very intensive hike... It took me almost 2 days to get to the top but I don't regret it, the view at the sunrise is stunning, it feels like being in the top of Taiwan.
There is no words to describe this place üòç... You need to check it out by yourself to understand.

Whenever I go to this town I am stunned by the incredible atmosphere.
Legend holds that Hayao Miyazaki's anime Spirited Away was inspired by Jiufen.
